review: ĞŸĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ€ Ğ½ĞµĞ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ¿ĞµĞ½ Ğ² ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ñ€ĞµĞ³Ğ¸Ğ¾Ğ½Ğµ

Here i have for you an honest review.

Most of the negative reviews are butt hurt basement dwellers that hold a grudge and don't give an objective take on the game. 

Core Game play: there are problems with the game like there is with every game. The game itself its bug free for the most part, there are few but they shouldn't be game breaking. Biggest complaint is that if you have someone on your team that is playing like crap, it's just GG go next, yeah you can bring it back but the odds are really against you. Another complaint is that people with stupidly good mechanical skill are going to be your nightmare, but with that being said you can win against them

Balance: Holy shit the devs really like to go on extreme ends of the scale with balance, they buff already broken characters and leave certain ones in the dust, the balance can be bad often but there will be states in the game where the balance is very very good.

Community:
Toxic as fuck, there will be really good people to interact with but they are exceptionally rare.

Battlepass and Shop:
The skins are generally really good, the free track has gotten better and they have made it easier to earn battle pass levels, but the best ones are still behind the premium track, and worst of all sometimes the skins don't match the event and skins that were clearly for the event end up being put in the store, you can earn in game currency by doing challenges to buy it but only every second battle pass. Having the hero in the battle pass is a brain dead move that is clearly just for monetisation and just really bloody scummy.

History: 
Overwatch is a complicated game with a complicated history, people have a reason to be butt hurt and salty but the community around it takes it to the next extreme of being salty for months if not years. The game is worth playing if you think you'll enjoy it, i would not recommend buying any cosmetics on price alone, i would not recommend buying the PVE because its horribly overpriced. But i would recommend the game, it can be fun and the team behind the game seems to be trying to rebuild some trust, they screwed up badly and they have peeved their community off for it. They didn't catch up on their old content, they weren't entirely truthful and they ruined Overwatch 1 for a game that didn't need to exist.

Closing thoughts:

I am not someone that will defend the company or make excuses for their actions, but i am also not so immature to review bomb a game and rate it negatively because of emotions. Team 4 royally screwed up and that is something to take into consideration when deciding to play the game, the game is good but if someone abstains from playing because the company behind it is scummy, that is perfectly valid. If you are going to not play though because of the company, read through what they have done in the first place to get to this point, instead of listening to review bombs

Un buen juego (mi favorito) creado por Jeff Kaplan y arruinado totalmente por Blizzard y la avaricia corporativa. La idea original de este juego totalmente mancillada por aquellos que viven entre informes trimestrales y que hace mucho perdieron el contacto con la realidad. Un amargo recordatorio de que arte y capitalismo no casan y de que, si les dejas, estas sanguijuelas acaban con todo.

Let's be honest, everyone expected Overwatch to be review bombed on Steam. Blizzard as of late has proven time and time again to actively disappoint the vast majority of the community with constant downfalls like the launch of Lifeweaver back in Season 4, the cancellation of talent trees in the PVE gamemode, and a bunch more scrapped content. I am here to be the one lone stand out to side with Overwatch as I believe that Season 6 has pushed a brand new breath of life into an overall underwhelming past year that has been Overwatch 2.

I'll begin talking about what I find great so far about the launch of this season, starting with well, the launch. While the push onto Steam came with the bugs of not receiving the content you paid for, those of us that started on Battle.net had a smooth ride into the season with basically no issues, no queues, nothing bad to note. I recently as of tonight downloaded and tried Overwatch on Steam to see if it feels any different and honestly, yeah. For some god forsaken reason the game runs much better on Steam than it does on Battle.net. I don't feel frame drops nearly as much as I did and somehow my latency dropped from an average of 45 down to 28. I believe the pricing of the new PvE missions is fair. "How the hell do you think the pricing is fair? We should've gotten it for free!" Think about it in a perspective of someone who plays Overwatch regularly, I was bound to buy the battle pass anyway at the start of the season, so lashing out an extra $5 for not only permanent access to the 3 new PvE missions but also the challenges and rewards included within them, as well as once completed you get a not half bad Sojourn legendary. I'll take it! The PvE missions on first play through gave about an hour worth of content, but there are also other challenges that give you extra rewards and battle pass experience if you care for that. Moving on past PvE to talk about the new support, Illari. I think she came out with a pretty decent fluid kit, albeit maybe a bit to damage packed and easily countered within killing her pylon. Overall a very fun character and a welcome addition compared to the release of Lifeweaver. The battle pass is well, a battle pass. I'll get it fully complete and be happy with my $10 spent for it so no complaining there. The new Flashpoint game mode is a ton of fun in my opinion, bringing back old 2CP vibes and being a much better counterpart to the Push game mode everyone despises.

Moving onto the bad of the season which really isn't very much to note besides balance changes. Cassidy has had his health fluctuate from 200 to 225 like 2-3 times now and he's always become a stronger pick when his health was shot up and this season is no different once again, only time will tell if history repeats itself, glad his grenade got nerfed though. Last season I did not think Lifeweaver was in a shit tier anymore, I think he held his own against some of the better supports in the game, often topping healing at the cost of possible damage boost of a Mercy, or anti nade/sleep/nano of an Ana, but now in Season 6 they transformed him into a monster. I full on believe he may become the best support in the game with both his buffs to survivability but the massive amount of direct and indirect buffs his tree got, and the overhealth change is bonkers.

Overall, if you think you want to give Overwatch a try, it's probably worth a shot. The game under all the deep layers of broken promises and shitty lies Blizzard gave the community, it truly can still be a fun game.

what a stupid game. just die.

People leaving negative reviews not because game is bad. 
Everyone loves Overwatch but what we hate is delusional team that can't understand what players actually want and keeps repeating same BS.

Everyone has their own reason what they don't like, what i don't like is competitive mode so my reason are:

1. Ranked system. Having 5 wins 15 loses is total crap. Give us normal system like LOL have or something.
Clear, transparent and easy to understand. That's what we want.

2. Matchmaker. It's not fair to have worst teammate in the lobby when you are best one (I'm not saying i always best, it's just an example). It's not fair at all. Just make it more random. Lets say find pairs by role for each player, but how you mix those players together should be random. That way it's still balanced and random enough so with enough games only factor that matters is my skill and not the system. You have to have some randomness.
There is so much more to say, but next time.

3. New players in competitive. Stop puting new players in Plat and Diamond ranks. People having alt accounts 1000 SR higher when they stuck on their main. It's just stupid, it ruins everyones games.
Remove Quick Play MMR from initial Competitive mode.
Every role should have 10 placement matches. Everyone should start in Silver, you lose 10 you end up in Bronze, you win 10 you end up in Gold and then you go from there. Easy, simple, transparent and just works. What's wrong with that?

4. MMR. You can leave it for now if you fix 3 first points. But you probably need to remove a lot of calculations and keep it simple and clear.
Actually... do we really need it? What was exactly wrong with matches by SR? Smurfs? So we ruining 99% player base games by boosting random people where they not belong just to protect from smurfs which is like 1% of players or something?
I mean we already have a number so why we need more numbers that tells same story?

Just stop inventing the wheel when simple things works best.

I love Overwatch. It's my only game that i keep playing for years and that's why i'm leaving negative review. Because i can't play it anymore.

No matter what anyone says, the game is still really fun to play. 
It's sad that the marketing and roadmap changes for it have ruined all the hype that there should be. 
Oh, and the player base is one of the most toxic out there. 
I'm sorry to any new player coming in that has to unlock all the heroes.
But at the end of the day, I still have a lot of fun with the game and will still continue to support it's development.

If you are new to the game you may not know how the quality of game play has been on a continuous decline since the introduction of Overwatch 2. For those of us that have been around for years with Overwatch 1, the trend continues to lean towards aggressive monetization and further away from quality game play. 

The match making has become complete garbage. It's not only the balance of players in the lobby, but there is no consideration to the quality of connection between the players. Hit registration is dodgy, at best. Without any way to determine how bad the connection is between the various players to the server. Basically, good luck enjoying your unregistered shots. It's horribly inconsistent and there's no real way to resolve it. No region locking as far as anyone can tell.

Truly, this game feels as if they have hired a new development team and their only job is to utilize old, unused assets in the best way they can to turn a dime before the Microsoft purchase goes through. This ends up getting half baked PVE content and broken balance between heroes. To the point that it's blatantly obvious that the leadership of the game is more focused on income generation than quality. With their latest release of season 6, they doubled down on pay to win by making the new hero so ridiculously overpowered that it basically is a loss if you don't have the new hero on your team. You can only get this new hero by paying the $15 extra for the seasonal battle pass to unlock the hero at the season start. Otherwise, you must wait until the middle of the battle pass to unlock the new hero for free. Which will be enough time for there to be a nerf patch for re-balancing purposes. But not before it encourages everyone to buy into the battle pass just to have a fighting chance to play the overpowered hero.

I would completely expect the game to take a severe nose dive after season 6 due to lack of content creation in the pipeline. At this point, the only hope for a quality Overwatch game would be for Microsoft to do something useful with it.

Additionally, the competitive elo ranking of this game is based more on time played and money invested than actual skill. If you don't grind competitive ranks through hours of game play, your rank will not go up, regardless of skill. There are many Youtube vidoes demonstrating stuck elo players and I have witnessed this first hand. It's shameful really.

Last but not least, the anti-cheat in this game is non existent. You can find many youtube vidoes analyzing cheaters in all game modes.

Good luck finding fairness or balance in this game.

*Late Additions*
The sound engine is garbage. Many of the ability spells can't even be heard. As in no sound at all from them. Enemy ultimate abilities sometimes produce no sound, which tends to result in a steamroll.

The new game mode is a running simulator. The distance between spawn and the point or point to point is too far and yielding the team on point at least 20% of the control value before you even get there.
